items.sentence: I wonder whether there's a chance that Tom will be here tomorrow.
You know as well as I do that there's no chance Tom will do that.
You know as well as I do there's no chance that Tom will do that.
I don't think you need to tell Tom why you were absent yesterday.
I don't think it's just me who thinks what Tom is doing is wrong.
I don't think it's a very good idea for you to hang out with Tom.
I don't think Tom knows Mary can speak French better than he can.
I don't think I need to tell Tom about what we're planning to do.
Tom told me that he didn't know anybody who lived on Park Street.
I wasn't surprised when Tom told me that he wanted me to do that.
